profile_positions.description:
Development of sustainable energy projects (waste heat recovery; district heating; biogas);

Preparation of municipal energy and climate program for the municipality of Coevorden. Assessment of energy saving potential in different sectors (households; agriculture; industry and transport) and of application of sustainable energy (solar, wind and biomass including biogas production)

Development of the Energy and Climate programme for the province of Zeeland in close consultation with industry sector organisation, environmental organisations, housing corporations and representatives from agriculture. Workshop organisation where results were presented and discussed.

Work with the Energytransition model (www.energytransitiemodel.nl) to adapt it for application at local and regional level, in cooperation with Quintel, developer of the model.

Distribution of the Grontmij Energy Management and Monitoring system aimed at energy saving through continuous monitoring of electricity and gas consumption.

Optimisation of biogas utilisation at wastewater treatment plants for STOWA (Research Foundation for the Dutch Water Authorities): comparison of alternatives for biogas utilisation at a WWTP for three criteria: energy savings, CO2-emission reduction and feasibility. The following alternatives were compared: combined heat and power production; ORC; fuelcell, natural gas to the gasgrid, biogas for transport. 

Assessment study for the development of a regional district heating system for the Arnhem-Nijmegen Urban region, province of Gelderland. Assess the opportunities to link the existing district heating system in Arnhem with a new heat transport system for Nijmegen, through a greenhouse development area.

Assessment study for extension of the Arnhem district heating system: assessment of extension potential, identify main problems and barriers for extension and prepare recommendations for the position and role of the municipality of Arnhem.
